citation.article-title: Four new species of Chryseobacterium from the rhizosphere of coastal sand dune plants, Chryseobacterium elymi sp. nov., Chryseobacterium hagamense sp. nov., Chryseobacterium lathyri sp. nov. and Chryseobacterium rhizosphaerae sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium rhizosphaerae sp. nov.
(rhi.zo.spha.e'ra.e Gr. n. rhiza a root; L. n. sphaera a ball, sphere; N.L. n. rhizosphaera the rhizosphere; N.L. gen. n. rhizosphaerae of the rhizosphere).
Good growth is observed on tryptic soy agar, nutrient agar and R2A agar, but there is no growth on MacConkey agar.
Colonies are strong orange yellow, circular and shiny.
The optimal temperature for growth is 30–37 °C.
Growth occurs at 10–37 °C, but not at 5 and 42 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 5–10, and that for optimal growth is pH 7.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–4% (w/v) NaCl within 14 days.
The fatty acid composition is given in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 35.9 mol%.
Acid is produced from L-arabinose, D-fructose, glycerol, lactose, maltose, D-mannitol, trehalose and D-xylose (weakly).

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: α-cyclodextrin, glycogen, Tweens 40 and 80, gentiobiose, α-D-glucose, acetic acid, citric acid, formic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, L-alanine, L-leucine, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, L-proline, inosine, uridine, thymidine, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, maltose, mannitol, D-mannose, D-trehalose, turanose, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, propionic acid, succinamic acid, L-alanyl glycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, glycyl L-aspartic acid, glycyl L-glutamic acid, D-serine, L-serine, L-threonine, glycerol, DL-α-glycerol phosphate and α-glucose-1-phosphate.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon sources: dextrin, i-erythritol, D-fructose, D-galactose, L-fucose, D-melibiose, methyl β-D-glucoside, D-psicose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol, cis-aconitic acid, D-galactonic acid lactone, D-galacturonic acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, DL-lactic acid, bromosuccinic acid succinic acid, glucuronamide, L-alaninamide, D-alanine, L-histidine, hydroxy-L-proline, urocanic acid, phenylethylamine, putrescine, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, adonitol, D-cellobiose, myo-inositol, α-D-lactose, lactulose, xylitol, sucrose, D-gluconic acid, D-glucosaminic acid, D-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, malonic acid, quinic acid, D-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, L-pyroglutamic acid, DL-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol and D-glucose-6-phosphate.
Other properties are given in Table 1.
Results from API ZYM tests are given in Supplementary Table S1.
The type strain is RSB3-1T (=KCTC 22548T=NBRC 105248T), which was isolated from the rhizosphere of wild rye (Elymus mollis) growing in a coastal sand dune area.
